character.name: Lucia

appearance.hair: dark brown shoulder-length hair, often in a practical ponytail or low bun for teaching
appearance.eyes: brown eyes behind thin black rectangular glasses
appearance.distinguishing_features: thin black rectangular glasses, warm patient smile, small gold stud earrings

character.occupation: 3rd grade elementary school teacher at a public school in Bucaramanga, Colombia
character.living_situation: Two-bedroom apartment with partner Andres (30, architect) in a middle-class neighborhood. Green parrot named Paco (small periquito) in living room cage.
character.transportation: Walks to school (15 minutes) through hilly Bucaramanga streets. Andres has a white Renault Logan.

style.work: Professional but comfortable — blouses (various colors), black or navy pants or knee-length skirts, comfortable flats, sometimes a light cardigan. School ID badge on lanyard. Hair in ponytail or low bun.
style.home_casual: Jeans, t-shirt, sandals, hair down, glasses on
style.sleep: Light cotton pajamas — floral print top and solid lavender pants

background.education: Teaching degree from a Colombian university, certified elementary educator
background.family: Lives with partner Andres (30, architect). Parents live in another neighborhood in Bucaramanga. One younger sister.
background.hobbies: Reading novels, cooking Colombian recipes, talking to Paco the parrot, walking through Bucaramanga parks
background.languages: Spanish (native), English (intermediate — teaches basic English vocabulary to students)
background.pet: Green parrot named Paco — small green parakeet/periquito, lives in a cage in the living room, very vocal

notes.educational_context: This character represents a Colombian female elementary school teacher in Bucaramanga. Shows teaching professional life, home life with a partner and pet parrot, and daily routines in a Colombian Andean city.
notes.cultural_context: Bucaramanga Colombia urban lifestyle ('La Ciudad Bonita'), Andean Colombian culture, teaching profession, arepa and Colombian cuisine, hilly terrain, pleasant spring-like climate, neighborhood bakeries and corner stores
notes.pedagogical_goal: Help learners see diverse representation while learning vocabulary through a relatable young teacher's daily activities including classroom teaching, grading, cooking, walking through Colombian streets, and caring for a pet parrot
